newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: INTERVIEW - RMB upbeat on second half profit.
newsitem.headline: INTERVIEW - RMB upbeat on second half profit.

text.p: Rand Merchant Bank was on track to log higher profits for the year to June 30 on the back of a strong second half, managing director Paul Harris said on Monday.
"We've done very well. We're ahead of budget. Will we exceed it (last year's profit)? Yes, definitely," Paul Harris told Reuters at the launch of the bank's personalised merchant banking division.
Rand Merchant Bank's parent company, RMB Holdings Ltd, also would grow its full year bottom line, Harris said.
RMB Holdings' headline earnings per share for the half to December 31 rose 67 percent to 128 cents.
Harris said a the group's newer businesses, including its unit trusts and Aegis Insurance Co, had underpinned earnings growth for the second half.
"We've got a lot of companies in the early stage of growth that picked up where some companies are topping out," he said.
Harris said the group's insurance sector was mixed as its life business was maturing while growth in health premiums had surged.
"With Momentum Health, the only thing that's limiting it is the capacity to handle the business," he said.
Momentum Health is part of RMB's unit Momentum Life Assurers Ltd.
Unit trust divisions also had achieved explosive earnings growth.
"We've started a unit trust company and we started a linked unit trust company just last year. In one we're taking in 200 million rand a month. We're growing unbelievably," Harris said.
RMB's rules off the current year on June 30.
